title: Fix issues with graph.infertopics
body:
Fix the following in `graph.infertopics`

1. The `infertopics` method is currently failing if no edges are found for a node. This condition should be handled.
2. The topicrank index should be set to the length - 1 of topics instead of length given that the row has been added to the topic list already

title: Add additional indexes for embeddings
body:
Add support for additional indexes in an Embeddings instance. Overview below.

- Add a new parameter named `indexes`. This will define each index name and associated configuration.
- Add new parameter named `defaults`. When `defaults` is disabled, default model derivation should be skipped
- Additional indexes are only indexed when the top-level index has indexed data for that row. If no indexes are defined for the top-level embeddings, all data is passed through to the subindexes.
- Modify `similar()` clauses to have better parameter parsing. Supporting passing the `text`, `candidates`, `weights` and index name
- Add `index` parameter to search to enabling searching additional indexing when `content` is disabled.

title: Add top level imports
body:
Add top level imports for the main entry points, `Application` and `Embeddings`.

This will enable:

```python
from txtai import Application
from txtai import Embeddings
```

title: Update documentation for 6.0
body: Update txtai documentation with new and updated 6.0 features.

title: Add support for configurable text/object fields
body: Currently, the `text` and `object` fields are hardcoded throughout much of the code. This change will make the text and object fields configurable.

title: Add multilingual graph topic modeling
body: #507 added support for [Unicode Standard Annex #29](https://unicode.org/reports/tr29/#Word_Boundaries) segmentation. This change should be incorporated into graph topic modeling.

title: ANN improvements
body:
Make the following tweaks to the ANN package for consistency.

- **faiss** - When the `sample` parameter is enabled, create a random number generator and set a seed for consistent sampling between builds
- **hnsw** - Cast scores to floats in `search` method for consistency with other ANNs

title: Hybrid Search
body:
The recent sparse vector additions/improvements to txtai (#507, #508) open up the possibility of hybrid vector search (sparse and dense). This change will repurpose the scoring index already on an Embeddings instance for sparse vector search.

The overview on hybrid search is below.

- Modify how scoring works with an embeddings instance.
  - If terms is disabled, work as it does today. Term weighting for word vector based indexes. This use case isn't the most popular but it is useful for low resource languages.
  - If terms is enabled, use scoring as a sparse vector index.
- Merge sparse and dense query results using one of following:
  - [Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF)](https://plg.uwaterloo.ca/~gvcormac/cormacksigir09-rrf.pdf) when sparse scores aren't normalized
  - [Convex combination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convex_combination) when sparse scores are normalized

title: Better BM25
body:
The current scoring implementation was primarily designed to help weigh tokens for word vector models. But over the last year, a number of changes have been made to this package (#327, #351, #401).

This change will significantly improve the overall runtime performance of the scoring package. The initial `terms` implementation was rudimentary and will be replaced with a method that can be a top performing BM25 implementation in Python, close to the performance provided by [Apache Lucene](https://github.com/apache/lucene). 

Below is the list of changes for this issue.

- Create new term frequency sparse array format. Support efficient storage with the Python [arrays](https://docs.python.org/3/library/array.html) package.
- Store the sparse arrays as SQLite blobs per term
- Update all calculations for BM25, TF-IDF and SIF to support multi-dimensional NumPy arrays
- Add caching for term weight calculations
- Integrate #507 for full Unicode Text Segmentation support
- The `content` keyword will remain enabling a simple way to store metadata in small quantities alongside a scoring index.

title: Support Unicode Text Segmentation in Tokenizer
body: Currently, the tokenizer pipeline primarily supports English text. While this logic should be retained for backwards compatibility, the pipeline should be updated to support tokenization using the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm per the [Unicode Standard Annex #29](https://unicode.org/reports/tr29/#Word_Boundaries).

title: ScoringFactory does not support Chinese
body:
I refer to the following document：
https://github.com/neuml/txtai/blob/master/examples/39_Classic_Topic_Modeling_with_BM25.ipynb

Let me replace the data set with Chinese, and I can't find any results。

I tried to read the source code and found that token processing does not support Chinese?

```
Tokenizer.tokenize(data)
return [token for token in tokens if re.match(r"^\d*[a-z][\-.0-9:_a-z]{1,}$", token) and token not in Tokenizer.STOP_WORDS]
```

title: Add UUID auto-id
body:
#502 added the ability to generate auto-id's when not otherwise provided at index time. This change will enable generating UUIDs via the `autoid` parameter. The logic should support any of the [UUID functions](https://docs.python.org/3/library/uuid.html#uuid.uuid1) available to generate random and deterministic UUIDs.

For example:

```python
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

embeddings = Embeddings()
embeddings.index(["test"])
```

Currently creates an entry as `(0, "test", None)`.

and with this change:

```python
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

embeddings = Embeddings(autoid="uuid4")
embeddings.index(["test"])
```

Will instead create this entry as `("aa108dc5-442c-458a-8454-8c55f40af25d", "test", None)`.

The default method when not specified will continue to be a numeric sequence.

title: Reorganize embeddings configuration documentation
body: The current embeddings configuration page is getting hard to follow. Split this up into components.

title: Add keyword arguments to Embeddings constructor
body: Currently, embeddings configuration is passed via a dictionary parameter named `config`. Passing configuration as keyword arguments should also be supported.

title: Add "auto-id" capability to Embeddings
body:
Currently, an Embeddings instance requires each input to be a tuple of 3 elements, (id, data, tags). The vast majority of time, tags is empty and the id is an auto-generated number. 

This change will allow the following inputs when passing data to an insert/upsert operation.

- (id, data, tags) tuples (CURRENT)
- (id, data) tuples
- data elements

In the case of just data elements, an auto id index will be used. 

_Note: The application interface already has similar functionality._

title: Add ability for extractor to reference another pipeline in applications
body: Currently, the extractor loads it's own model internally in application configuration. A reference to an existing pipeline should be supported.

title: Support passing model parameters in pipelines
body:
Currently, all Hugging Face based pipelines have the following constructor.

```python
def __init__(self, path=None, quantize=False, gpu=True, model=None):
```

This allows setting the model path and target GPU device but prevents many necessary parameters from being passed to the models. For example, many of the new LLMs being released require the `trust_remote_code` parameter to be set. Running 4 and 8 bit quantization is another example. 

The current workaround is to create the models via the auto model classes and pass those to the pipelines. This works in Python but not with application YAML. 

This issue will do the following:

- Add kwargs parameters to all constructors and pass those parameters to the underlying pipeline
- Resolve arguments from strings as necessary (for example torch_dtype)

title: Improve Pooling tokenizer load method
body: Currently, the Pooling module assumes the tokenizer parameter in the `__init__` method is a string. Passing in a tokenizer instance should also be supported.

title: Incorrect results can be returned by embedding search when Content storage enabled
body:
There seems to be a correctness issue that manifests if the following conditions are met:

- Content storage ENABLED for the `Embeddings`
- Documents being indexed are python dicts
- One or more of the documents being indexed has an empty `'"text"` field in the dict (i.e. `{"text":""}`)

If all of these conditions are met, then it seems as though search results for all documents AFTER the first empty `"text"` field will be mis-aligned by the number of documents with empty text fields.

See below code to reproduce:

```
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings


dict_docs = [(1, {"text":""}, None), (2, {"text":"New York"}, None), (3, {"text":"California"}, None)]
text_docs = [(1, "", None), (2, "New York", None), (3, "California", None)]

dict_content_embed = Embeddings({"content":True,"path":"sentence-transformers/multi-qa-mpnet-base-dot-v1"})
dict_content_embed.index(dict_docs)

dict_no_content_embed = Embeddings({"content":False,"path":"sentence-transformers/multi-qa-mpnet-base-dot-v1"})
dict_no_content_embed.index(dict_docs)

text_content_embed = Embeddings({"content":True,"path":"sentence-transformers/multi-qa-mpnet-base-dot-v1"})
text_content_embed.index(text_docs)

text_no_content_embed = Embeddings({"content":False,"path":"sentence-transformers/multi-qa-mpnet-base-dot-v1"})
text_no_content_embed.index(text_docs)

print(f"Content+Dict Results:\n{dict_content_embed.search('New York')}\n")
print(f"No Content+Dict Results:\n{dict_no_content_embed.search('New York')}\n")
print(f"Content+Text Results:\n{text_content_embed.search('New York')}\n")
print(f"No Content+Text Results:\n{text_no_content_embed.search('New York')}\n")
```

The code will print:
```
Content+Dict Results:
[{'id': '3', 'text': 'California', 'score': 0.9999998807907104}, {'id': '2', 'text': 'New York', 'score': 0.2981969118118286}]

No Content+Dict Results:
[(2, 0.9999998807907104), (3, 0.5046365857124329), (1, 0.2981969118118286)]

Content+Text Results:
[{'id': '2', 'text': 'New York', 'score': 0.9999998807907104}, {'id': '3', 'text': 'California', 'score': 0.5046365857124329}, {'id': '1', 'text': '', 'score': 0.2981969118118286}]

No Content+Text Results:
[(2, 0.9999998807907104), (3, 0.5046365857124329), (1, 0.2981969118118286)]
```

As you can see, the embedding search _incorrectly_ returns document 3 (`"California"`) as the top match when the documents are python dicts and content storage is enabled.

title: Refactor Sequences and Generator pipeline into single LLM pipeline
body:
Currently, the Sequences and Generator pipelines load sequence to sequence and text generation models respectively. Both of these types of models can be used in a generative way and the logic should be refactored to make txtai easier to use with LLMs.

Logic to determine if a model is a sequence-sequence or text generation model should be added. The Sequences and Generator pipeline should extend the LLM pipeline and be a simple way to force the model type.

title: Add support for passing torch devices to embeddings and pipelines
body:
Building on #489, this issue will add support for direct torch devices (i.e. `torch.device`). 

With this change, the [DirectML](https://github.com/microsoft/DirectML) framework can be used to instantiate models on DirectX/Windows supported graphic cards.

title: Questions about natural language queries
body:
1. Whats the best way to retrieve more fields when using natural language queries in one go? (currently it returns only `id`, `text`, `score`)    

2. Currently `Embeddings.save` doesn't save `query` config. if I pass `query` when initialising `Embeddings`, calling `Embeddings.load` would reset the `query` on the instance. I believe [this](https://github.com/neuml/txtai/blob/5ed0a3c52b2c16c963a81d103d3ffd387c2a0123/src/python/txtai/embeddings/base.py#L490) should do a merge instead 🤔

3. It seems like time-based naturual language queries like "XXXX from last 5 hour" will always translate to `date('now', '-5 hours')` when it should be `DateTime('now', '-5 hours')`. I'm assuming to fix this, I will need to train the query model?

4. Is it possible to use natural language to query on multiple fields? for example if I'm indexing data like `{"text": "icecream", "location": "Michigan"}` and wanting to get them with queries like "desert" or "desert in New York" or "Michigan".

5. Similar to 3 and 4, if I want to translate "XXX from last 5 hours" and match on something like `data.cutsom_timestamp` in stead of `entry`, is is best to retrain the model?

title: Question about BM25 with respect to the scoring parameter and the ScoringFactory class
body:
Hi! Great library. I'm just exploring around informational retrieval libraries. I tried only gensim and sklearn tfidf so I'm pretty new here. Just want to ask the difference between using bm25 as scoring and without because they seem giving the same output and scores. I had an impression they be doing like hybrid search kind of thing like in pinecone.

```python
#without using bm25
embeddings_batch = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2", "content": True, "object": True})
start = time.time()
embeddings_batch.index(stream_products_tqdm())
print(f"Indexing took {time.time() - start} seconds")
embeddings_batch.search('hammer',5)
```

```python
# using bm25
embeddings_batch_bm25 = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2", "scoring":"bm25", "content": True, "object": True})
start = time.time()
embeddings_batch_bm25.score(stream_products_tqdm())
embeddings_batch_bm25.index(stream_products_tqdm())
print(f"Indexing took {time.time() - start} seconds")
print(embeddings_batch_bm25.info())
embeddings_batch_bm25.search('hammer',5)

## OUTPUT IS THE SAME 
```

also I tried doing bm25 with ScoringFactory,

```python
scoring = ScoringFactory.create({"method": "bm25", "terms": True, "content": True, "normalize": True})
scoring.index(stream_products_tqdm())
```

this two lines gives different results even with the same query

```python
scoring.search("SELECT * FROM txtai WHERE similar('hammer')")
```

```python
scoring.search("hammer")
```

I was interested in doing the sql query approach because I can show the tags for filtering that I used in `stream_products_tqdm()`
which has a function (pseudo-code) of 

```python
for uid, text, metadata in rows:
        if text:
            yield(uid, text, metadata)
```

title: Add support for alternative acceleration devices
body:
Currently, there isn't a good way to detect and run models on alternative GPU-like acceleration devices. The current code is geared towards CUDA devices. The code should be updated to look for CUDA, MPS and XPU devices.

When `gpu=True` or `gpu=<positive int>` the logic should continue to first look for CUDA devices then MPS, if available and finally XPU.

More information on MPS and XPU devices can be found at the links below.

- MPS - https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/mps.html
- XPU - https://pytorch.org/tutorials/recipes/intel_extension_for_pytorch.html

This change will give better overall support on Macbook M1's and Windows machines with discrete Intel GPUs such as Intel Arc.

The following additional links have more information on other devices that should work with the current version of txtai.

- ROCm - https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/hip.html
- ONNX - https://onnxruntime.ai/docs/execution-providers/

[DirectML](https://github.com/microsoft/DirectML) is another project to watch. But at this time it doesn't provide a way to instantiate a device via a device string.

title: Add WAL option for SQLite
body: Currently, the SQLite content storage engine uses all default settings, including the `journal_mode` setting. In some cases, this can result in a `database is locked` error. Adding the option to set `journal_mode = WAL` will help better support concurrent read and write operations.

title: Unique constrant violation issue with DuckDB
body:
Inserting duplicate ids with DuckDB in the same transaction throws a `Constraint Error`. This works fine in SQLite. 

According to DuckDB, this is expected behavior: https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb/issues/1631. As explained in the issue, an `INSERT OR REPLACE` statement is translated to a DELETE and UPDATE which with the current logic fails as two duplicate rows will exist during that operation. There is much discussion in that chain regarding if this is the right way to handle but it's the current way.

One way to workaround this issue is to run a separate DELETE statement and then run the INSERT.

Really nice work on the repository, you have super useful functionalities and I think it's very intuitive to use, so thank you!

#### Description
I noticed when performing similarity search and setting a limit above/equal to the number of indexed documents, then often the number of results is less than the number of documents. The issue is also present if the search is performed as an SQL query with the similar() function (eg. "select text from txtai where similar('etc') limit 10000"). Is there another reason results would be excluded?

#### Details
Model: sentence-transformers/paraphrase-multilingual-MiniLM-L12-v2
txtai: 5.5.1
Python: 3.8.15
OS Name: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise
OS Version: 10.0.19045 Build 19045


#### Code to reproduce
```
from itertools import combinations

from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

WORDS = ("a bunch of words that will be permuted in order to create documents for indexing").split()
docs = []
for i in range(2, len(WORDS) - 1):
	docs += [" ".join(x) for x in combinations(WORDS, i)]

embeddings = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/paraphrase-multilingual-MiniLM-L12-v2"})
embeddings.index([(uid, text, None) for uid, text in enumerate(docs)])

I have also experienced it in an embedding index with the content parameter set to true. This was actually the use case that lead to me encountering this, as I was trying to filter by a precomputed and stored field and sort by similarity, but not all documents were present.

title: Add DuckDB support

title: Add workflow streams
body:
Currently when running a workflow through the API, data is expected to be passed through the API. This is fine for most situations but inefficient when running a large data processing operation. 

When a workflow is run through Python, a generator can be passed to efficiently process a large dataset. This issue will add a new YAML argument to workflows named `stream`. A stream will effectively act as a data generator and stream data to the workflow. This will enable full server side processing of content. 

The following is an example workflow that indexes the [cnn_dailymail](https://huggingface.co/datasets/cnn_dailymail) Hugging Face dataset.

```yaml
writable: True
embeddings:
  path: sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2
  content: True 

tabular:
  idcolumn: id
  textcolumns:
    - highlights

workflow:
  index:
    stream:
      action: datasets.load_dataset
      args:
        name: 3.0.0
        split: test
    tasks:
      - tabular
      - index
```

title: Allow task action arguments to be dictionaries in addition to tuples
body:
Currently, task action arguments are expected to be tuples. This is problematic when wanting to only set a single argument, especially in a longer list.

Keyword arguments should also be supported via parameters being passed as dictionaries.

title: Add extractor reference output format
body:
Add a new output format named 'reference'. When this is set, the extractor pipeline will add an additional field to the outputs called reference. The reference is the context record that best matches an answer. 

This is makes it possible to cite answer sources.

title: Add terms method to embeddings
body:
Add `terms` and `batchterms` methods to Embeddings. These methods will extract keyword terms from a query when it's SQL. Otherwise, the original inputs will be returned.

For example:

```sql
SELECT id, text, tags FROM txtai WHERE similar('keyword terms')
```

returns `keyword terms`. A query for `keyword terms` returns the original query.

title: Add custom detection function for language detection
Extractor pipeline improvements
body:
Make the following improvements to better support running the extractor pipeline in workflows.

- Update application to set `extractor.similarity` parameter to application embeddings after embeddings is created if `extractor.similarity` is None.
- Support extractor input queue being a dictionary in addition to a tuple.
- Add output format parameter. When set to "flatten", only answer text will be returned. Otherwise return (name, answer) tuples, which is the existing behavior.

title: Resolve application references in pipelines
body:
Add logic to detect application pipelines that have a configuration parameter named `application`. When that parameter is passed as part of the pipeline configuration, it will be resolved to the currently running application.

The application framework already has similar logic for setting the `embeddings` on `extractor` pipelines.

title: Large indexes remote(S3 or other) or local?
body:
Hey @davidmezzetti thanks for your great work and documentation. I just had a question about potentially large indexes, how would you approach that if you are running a serverless environment? Currently, looking to save indexes locally for performance reasons, would this be your recommended approach given that scenario?

> In addition to local storage, embeddings can be synced with cloud storage. Given that txtai is a fully encapsulated index format, cloud sync is simply a matter of moving a group of files to and from cloud storage. This can be object storage such as AWS S3/Azure Blob/Google Cloud or the Hugging Face Hub. More details on available options can be found in the documentation. There is also an article available that covers how to build and store indexes in cloud object storage.

I'm using txtai Docker API image according to the documentation: [docker build -t txtai-api .](https://neuml.github.io/txtai/cloud/)
If I want to use the zero-shot classifier I have to provide the labels in the config.yml

`# Workflow definitions

    entity:

title: Add notebook for syncing embeddings with the cloud
body: Build an example notebook that shows how to load and use an embeddings index from the cloud.

title: Add support for storing embeddings config as JSON
body:
Currently, embeddings configuration is pickled to file. A readable configuration file should also be supported. This change will add JSON support for loading/saving configuration. 

If the `format` parameter is set to json, then a config.json file will store configuration. Otherwise, pickled configuration will still be the default and stored in a file named `config`.

title: Add support for custom cloud providers
body: txtai has support for syncing indexes with cloud object storage (S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage and more) and the Hugging Face Hub. This change will add hooks to allow developers to plug in their own implementation of index syncing.

title: Add cloud object storage support for uncompressed embeddings indexes
body: Currently, cloud object storage only supports compressed embeddings indexes stored in a single file. This should be changed to allow standard uncompressed embeddings indexes.

title: Add Hugging Face Hub integration
body:
Add support for loading and saving embeddings indexes with the [Hugging Face Hub](https://hf.co/models). This will facilitate the sharing of embeddings indexes.

An example index is available here: https://hf.co/neuml/txtai-intro

title: Refactor archive module into separate package
body:
The embeddings archive module should be refactored as follows:

- Move archive into a new top level package
- Move all functionality under the compress package into the archive package
- Remove cloud sync functionality as that will be done elsewhere

title: Add support for instruction-based embeddings
body:
There are new models that support instruction-based embeddings. These models take a prefix that alters the way embeddings are generated.

[E5](https://huggingface.co/intfloat/e5-base) and [Instructor](https://huggingface.co/hkunlp/instructor-base) are examples of models that take instruction prefixes.

title: Add sample parameter to Faiss ANN
body:
Currently when building a Faiss index, all rows are used in the training step. For larger indexes, using all rows isn't necessary to build an accurate ANN index. A fraction of the data works well and vastly reduces indexing time. See the link below for more on this.

https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss/wiki/FAQ#how-can-i-distribute-index-building-on-several-machines

This issue will add a new parameter called `sample`. When set, this parameter will select a fraction of the data using random sampling. Once the model is trained, all rows will be added to the ANN index.

title: Modify translation pipeline langdetect parameter to accept language detection function
body:
*See [this comment](https://github.com/neuml/txtai/issues/423#issuecomment-1426777995) for details on what to implement for this issue*

First and foremost, I've been getting errors while trying to install fasttext with a different package managers (pdm and poetry) and python versions (3.8-3.10). Looking at the issues in their repo, it seems that this is a [common issue](https://github.com/facebookresearch/fastText/issues/1298) for [many people](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/6113).

Someone created [a simple pull request](https://github.com/facebookresearch/fastText/pull/1292) 6 months ago to fix this and it has been ignored - as have hundreds of other Issues and PRs. The project just seems to be abandoned.

But [Lingua](https://github.com/pemistahl/lingua-py) appears to be a new and very promising language detection tool. There is lots of Their benchmarks show increased accuracy, though they don't have any performance metrics for comparison. 

At the very least, could the fasttext dependency be switch to [this repo ](https://github.com/cfculhane/fastText) (the 6 month old bugfix PR)?

Issue is - Topics and Categories of my text embeddings getting deleted after upserting. But text, id and else things are remaining as usual.

**Steps to reproduce the issue:**
1. Configure the settings in a ".yml" file, and set path and graph topics & categories. (I am using the same config mentioned in semantic graphs example.)
2.  Create a list of sentences and index them one by one to txtai 
3. Search the embeddings using SQL query "select topic,text,category from txtai where id=1"
4.  Iam picking the sentence with id = 1, (you can pick anything, but /add and /upsert the same again)
5. Pick the sentence which has id=1 (or any one of the sentences that you have), and delete it and /add /upsert it again.
6. Now, Search using SQL query again "select topic,text,category from txtai where id=1"
7. Observe

For me, for the first time right after indexing , I could see the topics and categories for each text when I search with SQL query. But after upserting I am getting value as "null" for topics and categories for the text that I upsert.
It is working fine with index but not with upsert API.

Please refer the issue #394  to see the config I'm using.

title: Extractor pipeline 2.0
body:
**This is major update on the path to `Generative Semantic Search`**

The extractor pipeline was one of the first components in txtai, going all the way back to 1.0. Since then, much has changed both with txtai and externally. This pipeline has a lot of potential but it needs a couple updates.

Make the following upgrades to the Extractor pipeline.

- Ability to run embeddings searches. Given that content is supported, text can be retrieved from the embeddings instance.
- In addition to extractive qa, support text generation models, sequence to sequence models and custom pipelines
- Better detection of when a tokenizer should be used (word vector models only)

These changes will enable a prompt-driven approach to question-answering with LLMs. This includes Hugging Face models and external services like OpenAI/Cohere. Services can be called directly or with another library like langchain. Custom pipelines only require a `__call__` interface.
